#Text=Make an Elevator
#Text=an Express Elevator
#Text=Say you 're on the first floor and your meeting is on the tenth .
#Text=You get in the elevator , but you do n't want it to stop because you 'll be late .
#Text=Here are some hacks to help get you to floor faster .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Using Button Codes and Other Methods
#Text=Press and hold your floor .
#Text=In some elevators , simply pressing your floor and holding it will do the trick .
#Text=You have to hold the button all the way to your floor .
#Text=Use the " Close Door " button .

column3:

column1: #Text=When you get on the elevator , press the " Close Door " button .
#Text=Often , this button will be two triangles pointing in towards each other .
#Text=Continue holding the " Close Door " button as you push your floor .
#Text=In some elevators , this combination will give you an express ride .
#Text=This combination often works on Otis , Desert , and Dover elevators .
#Text=Note that sometimes the " Close Door " button is just a placebo for impatient riders , so this trick may not work .

column1: #Text=Cancel other highlighted floors .
#Text=In some elevators , you can cancel floors that have already been pressed .
#Text=Of course , if people see you do so , they will probably not be very happy .
#Text=Or , they may press their floor button again .
#Text=The simplest method is to double press the button , which works in Mitsubishi Electric .
#Text=In other brands , such as Fujitec , pressing it five times works .
#Text=Another method is to hold the " Open Door " button while pressing the floor button twice .
#Text=Use your foot .
#Text=Some people suggest that you can use your foot to keep the door from opening .
#Text=Simply put your foot on the middle of the elevator door , covering the edges of the door .
#Text=In theory , the sole of your shoe will keep the door from opening on floors .
#Text=Ask your building manager .
#Text=If you 're cozy with your building manager , you may be able to get the secret elevator code from him or her .
#Text=However , you may need to promise to use it only for good .
#Text=Using the Master Key
#Text=Ask for a copy of the master key .
#Text=The master key will give you an express ride if you have one .
#Text=Your building 's manager should have a key , and if you have enough clout , you may be able to just ask for a copy of the key .
#Text=Ask your firefighter friends .
#Text=Firefighters have master keys that work on most elevators , as they need them in case of emergency .
#Text=If you know someone in the profession , you may be be able to convince him or her to give you a copy of the elevator 's key .
#Text=However , understand that your firefighter friend is likely to be reluctant .
#Text=Putting master keys in the hands of the public can be dangerous and possibly even illegal .
#Text=Check the legality of having such a key in your area .
#Text=Check eBay .
#Text=If you fail in your quest , you can also check eBay for master keys .
#Text=You can look for all-access keys that should work in a variety of elevators .
#Text=Most of these have four sides to work in multiple types of elevators .
#Text=Buying keys is somewhat of a legal gray area .
#Text=Check to see if it 's legal in your state before purchasing one .
#Text=However , to make sure the key you buy works on your elevator , you may need to do a little research .
#Text=Look at the make and model of your elevator , which is usually listed inside the elevator .
#Text=Use that information to find out what kind of key it takes .
#Text=Use the key .
#Text=To use the key , insert it in the keyhole when you get in the elevator .
#Text=You may need to try more than one if it 's four-sided .
#Text=Leave the key in .
#Text=Push the button of your floor to get an express ride .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Realize that these hacks will not work on every elevator .
#Text=In fact , some people contend that the code hacks do not work at all .
#Text=Use these hacks sparingly , especially in large office buildings , where there are busy people with places to be .
#Text=Quick Summary
